prompt.p: Study the following diagram of the principal tests relating to the coagulation cascade:
(B) Principle of the activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT).
Using the above diagrams and knowledge of the coagulation cascade, which of the following statements is INCORRECT regarding principal investigations relating to coagulation?

choiceInteraction.simpleChoice: The prothrombin time (PT) is used to assess the extrinsic pathway and to monitor warfarin therapy
Activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT) is used to assess the intrinsic pathway and to check for factor deficiencies and monitor heparin therapy
Thrombin clotting time is used to check for disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) but will also be prolonged in the presence of heparin
Correction tests are used if there is a reduced clotting time in order to assess for factor deficiency versus presence of clotting factor inhibitor
Coagulation factor assays are used to determine the actual deficiency

modalFeedback.p: Option D (Correction tests are used if there is a reduced clotting time in order to assess for factor deficiency versus presence of clotting factor inhibitor) is Correct. Correction tests are used if there is a prolonged clotting time.

Option A (The prothrombin time (PT) is used to assess the extrinsic pathway and to monitor warfarin therapy) is Incorrect. This statement is true.
Option B (Activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT) is used to assess the intrinsic pathway and to check for factor deficiencies and monitor heparin therapy) is Incorrect. This statement is true.
Option C (Thrombin clotting time is used to check for disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) but will also be prolonged in the presence of heparin) is Incorrect. This statement is true.
Option E (Coagulation factor assays are used to determine the actual deficiency) is Incorrect. This statement is true.

Option D (Correction tests are used if there is a reduced clotting time in order to assess for factor deficiency versus presence of clotting factor inhibitor) is Correct. Correction tests are used if there is a prolonged clotting time.
